Patent Information.Abstract: The invention concerns an antimicrobial peptide, called myticin, characterised in that it can be obtained from a bivalve mollusc shellfish, and its molecular mass is about 4.5 kDa; its pI is about 8.7; it comprises 8 cystein radicals. The invention also concerns its preparation and its uses. The invention further concerns a nucleic acid coding for said peptide.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MBC=1-2 µM), Bacillus megaterium (MBC=1-2 µM), Aerococcus viridans (MBC=2-4 µM).Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli D31 (MBC=20-10 µM).Fungi:Fusarium oxysporum (MIC=5-10 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Bacteriolytic activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-negative bacteria. Also possesses antifungal activity against F. oxysporum.

Literature.Title: Myticin, a novel cysteine-rich antimicrobial peptide isolated from haemocytes and plasma of the mussel Mytilus galloprovincialis.
Literature.Author: Mitta G, Hubert F, Noël T, Roch P.
